Detailed Description

Contains the c interface for the LastFmScrobbler class.

Author:
Dirk Vanden Boer

Function Documentation

lastfm_scrobbler* create_scrobbler ( const char *  username,
const char *  password,
int  synchronous 
)

Create Last.fm scrobbler struct

Parameters:
username Last.fm username
password Last.fm password
synchronous If 0 all functions will be executed in a thread and return immediately (prevents long blocking methods in case of network problems)
Returns:
lastfm_scrobbler structure

void finished_playing ( lastfm_scrobbler *  scrobbler  ) 

Indicate that the current track has stopped playing. The current track will be submitted to Last.fm

void pause_playing ( lastfm_scrobbler *  scrobbler,
int  paused 
)

Indicate that playback of the current track has been (un)paused

Parameters:
scrobbler initialized scrobbler struct
paused 1 if track is being paused, 0 if being unpaused

void set_commit_only_mode ( lastfm_scrobbler *  scrobbler,
int  commit_only 
)

When commit only mode is set, now playinginfo is not updated on Last.fm, tracks will only be commited once they finished playing

Parameters:
scrobbler initialized scrobbler struct
commit_only set commitOnlyMode to 1 or 0

void started_playing ( lastfm_scrobbler *  scrobbler,
const submission_info *  info 
)

Indicate that a new track has started playing, the previous track will be submitted (if available) and the new track will be set as Now Playing

Parameters:
scrobbler initialized scrobbler struct
info submission_info struct containing information about the new song
